Tucson smiles at the sound of Talon's knock and opens the door for her, bow=
ing politely while offering his hand in a gentleman manner.

" Talon, thank=
 you for joining me.  Please, come in."

Tucson had never experienced true =
courtship before but something in his spark was showing him how.  It was as=
 if another part of his spark was being activated for the first time but wh=
atever it was, he welcomes the new sensation gladly.  Now he knew how happy=
 Rodimus felt when he was around Nightlight and the tremendous love he expe=
riences every day.  Now it was Tucson's turn to show Talon how much he love=
s her, which to him was infinite.  

" Talon I have to confess, before I me=
t you I didn't know what courtship was and how to go about it.  Then that f=
irst time when I tried to tell you that I really admired you, I was at a lo=
ss as how you would perceive my intentions.  But now, thanks to you, I was =
able to come out of my shell and for that I will always love you with every=
 inch of my spark.  And now, here we are, together again and ready for the =
next step."

He gently takes Talon's hands into his own.

" Talon, will you=
 show me the way?"

Outside, the mare and the filly shake their heads and t=
rot off in the other direction, thanks to Windlord's help.  Quickstride hea=
ves a sigh of relief.

" That was close, thanks I owe ya one, buddy.  I am =
so not ready for a serious relationship right now.  Especially when it come=
s to attracting Natural life.  It just wouldn't be right ya know.  Leo Prim=
es right, this isn't our world to upset.  If anything it needs to be preser=
ved.  Ecology is so important to an evolving planet and there is no need to=
 upset the balance.  I wonder how much of Cybertron is left, and if we stil=
l have our world to go home to.."

He looks over to Windlord as he sits dow=
n in the grass, watching bees buzzing around opened water blossoms, gatheri=
ng nectar to convert into honey.  




Perpetually on the move and constant=
ly busy. 

On Jul 7, 2011, at 1:49 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@hotma=
il.com> wrote:

  ultrasonic way trying to scare of the wild horses.
>

> Ooc: gotchya.
>  
> BIC:
>  
> Tucson nods and turns to get ready =
for a little alone time with Talon.
>  
> Yet he turns back to Wheelie.
>  =

> " If that's what you want, that's fine by me, Wheelie.  But keep in mind=
, it doesn't hurt to have a friend as well as a comrade by your side. I lea=
rned that many vorns ago when I started working with the Autobots.  And yes=
 war is a difficult time and we can not weaken our defenses but, it doesn't=
 mean we have to be anti social either.  Strength is in numbers.  That was =
one of Master Yokitron's words."
>  
> Tucson backs into his private quarte=
rs and closes the door softly.
> 
> Perpetually on the move and constantly =
busy.
> 
> On Jul 6, 2011, at 10:20 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...>=
 wrote:
> 
>>  
>> 
>> > 
>> > Meanwhile, in Tucson's quarters, Tucson look=
s down at Wheelie and realizes that he had no idea of his change of status,=
 seeing that the last time they were together Tucson was just an average co=
mrade, just a slight larger than Wheelie. He heaves a sigh and kneels down =
to Wheelie.
>> > 
>> > " I was going to give you a lecture and a warning bu=
t I realize you just comeback online after many vorns . You were not aware =
of my change of status to Prime office and perhaps mistook me for my previo=
us status. I'll let it go this one time, Wheelie but keep in mind that a Pr=
ime is a Prime no matter who they are. All right, you're free to roam the A=
uto base now. Please try not to get sent to my office again, okay?"
>> > 
>=
> > With a smile of understanding, Tucson opens the door to let Wheelie go =
on his way. Once having let Wheelie free, he waits for Talon with a light h=
earted smile on his face.
>> > 
>> 
>> OOC - Uhm, I posted Wheelie leaving =
your quarters and he never entered them in the first place, then him headin=
g out. So there's no way he coudl have been there, and he wouldn't have gon=
e back over to them! So will pose this as taking place out in the ship corr=
idors. Thanks!
>> 
>> Also, I appreciate your posting, but it's sort of wei=
rd how you have each and every character of your's coming up, then doing so=
mething to me, then knowing each and every thing that happened to each adn =
every other one that did, and them all having the exact same opinions over =
on everyone as everyone else did. 
>> 
>> Also, unless your characte ris as=
uperior officer who's going to emphatically order him to do something, plea=
se don't pose him going somewhere far else after you for a setup. Since it'=
s hideously unrealistic for him to go back to Tuscon's quarters twice now a=
s you've posed him doing when he's not especially fond of Tuscon, nor him f=
ollowing someone else as well when I posd him trying to leave. So, if going=
 to go somewhere with him, please give me a cahnce to respond to it ahead o=
f time. It's two times you posed him extensively going with your characters=
 when it was not in character for him to do so.
>> 
>> If your characters h=
ave had interactions with him in the past or things I should know of, let m=
e know? As I have no idea where Wheelie interacted with Tuscon or how they =
would have remotely konwn of one another, and you've posted repeaetdly that=
 Tuscon knows him from the past, when I have no idea of that.
>> 
>> So aga=
in, if they've had interactions as NPC's, let me know their generic history=
 so I can respond appropriately. If he's going to be told to go somewhere w=
tih someone, either give me a chance to respond appropriately if he does or=
 not, or make it something like a specific order in the case someone is a s=
uperior. And it's also rather weird how your characers come up from nowhere=
, all have the exact same opininos and back one another up to the hilt on t=
hier interactions and everything. I feel kind of wedged into a corner by th=
is.
>> 
>> I understand I'm new to the gruop and you've been here much long=
er, I just feel rather hemmed in on the character with what you're doing an=
d am confused as to how things operate, and how you have all of your alts c=
ongregating and making me feel pressed into a corner.
>> 
>> Anyways, sorry=
 if this is coming fof a bit too negative, thank you very much for the welc=
ome here and for playing wtih me and interacting with Wheelie.
>> 
>> <Back=
 In Character>
>> 
>> Wheelie, having met Tuscon up in the hall, gazes over=
 at him, "What is this with all of you? You're back and forth whatever I do=
. This is what Prime is, just a rank? It seems like it's just sort of dank.=
 We had four of five in a room, that's not a level of doom and gloom."
>> 
=
>> Then, walking away from Tuscon, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're goo=
d with all of your friends, congrualtions on the promotion and to whatever =
ends. But we, we were never friends. We went back and forth in our ways, an=
d I respect your orders for these days. But we're not here to have fun, we'=
re here to fight and run and gun."
>> 
>> Wheelie leaning against the wall,=
 "I'll work wtih you, if you do tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell. I=
'd prefer to keep my own advice, and I appreciate your friends, they try an=
d be nice. But don't have them ganging up on me and telling me what to do, =
or how you'll react, or on you'll I chew. So by al lmeans, give me some spa=
ce, we're here to fight for the future of our race."
>> 
>> 
> 
> 

--Apple-Mail-18-1030370624

e tremendous love he experiences every day.  Now it was Tucson's turn =

ext step."</div><div><br></div><div>He gently takes Talon's hands into his =
